result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea to Count 2.  Dismiss/ read in Count 1, 3 & 4.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Raabe agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  State clarifies motion pending are withdrawn.  Attorney Raabe agrees motions filed by defendant are withdrawn.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 2:
$268.00 fine/costs and $250.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
Submit to DNA sample, unless already provided.
Paperwork handed in court.

to Dismiss for Failure to Disclose Exculpatory Evidence in a timely manner
Amicus Curiae NMM to Dismiss for Failure to Disclose Exculpatory Evidence in a timely manner

Final pre-trial at 02-08-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 02-17-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo appeared by phone means from Prairie du Chien Correcitonal. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Telephone conference at the courts request.  Court has reconsidered its view on appointment/getting an attorney.  Relatively new discovery discovered.  Court grants request for time to get an atty. due to new discovery, incarcerated and still in wheelchair.  Court will provide in writing the public defenders number.  DE will have to make the appropriate arrangements.  Court will continue the trial and reset to 2/17/16. Final pre trial for 2/8/16.  ADA Albrecht concurs with Court.  DE inquires on court appointment of atty. paperwork.  Court will send all appropriate paperwork.  Jury trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
to Dismiss.  Failure to Disclose Exculpatory Evidence in a Timely Manner

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court, in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances are stated.  Court notes document filed on 12/3/2015.  Court notes they are entitled to 5 days notice of motions and are not prepared to proceed w/that motion today.  DE makes statement re: UCC and jurisdiction.  Court explains to the DE that the State has the 5 days notice as required and this will be heard prior to the JT next week.  Court questions street clothes for DE for the JT.  DE states he has clothes at the prison he can wear.  Court responds it's up to the prison procedure but street clothes will be permitted at the JT.  Court questions DE re: counsel waiver again.  DE responds by stating status from hearing in September re: his surgery, etc.  Court reponds.  Parties discuss motions by DE.  Court has document filed as exhibit #1.  Court notes any further issues could be addressed the day before trial.  DE states he wishes to hold open the right to have an attorney if he wishes to get one.  Court admonishes DE re: counsel and states if he decides to get one they will have to be ready to go to trial next week as scheduled.  DE states he would now like the Court to appoint him an attorney.  State responds against reset at this point as DE has been advised numerous times re: counsel.  Court admonishes DE as to how many times they've gone through this.  Court finds he was waived his right to counsel and any attorney would need to be ready to proceed next week.  DE objects to Court denying his request for court-appointed counsel.  Court considers the request for counsel too late and it's forfeited.  FPT is completed and Court is in recess.
cover page for re-submitting into the record

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court, in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht and Denny Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes statement re: defendant's right to counsel and having counsel present today.  Defendant makes statement re: birth certificate and other documents filed.  Court reviews file and documents filed by defendant.  Court summarily denies motion.  Defendant objects to denial to motion.  State agrees with court, claims stated do not rise in a criminal action.  Court again addresses right to counsel.  Defendant addresses surgery coming in September, request postponement of jury trial.  Copy of documents given to the State.  Marked exh 1, Birth Certificate and exh 2, Corrections letter.  Court states exhibits.  Defendant makes statement regarding upcoming surgery and history of injury.  Defendant requesting a 2-3 month reset.  State makes statement.  Concerned with delay, however leaves for the court to decide the issue.  Court directs State to confirm surgery, if able.  Court denies continuance at this point, pending further confirmation of such surgery.

from defendant - Judicial notice to the Court in Chambers Motion to Dismiss

Final pre-trial at 08-26-2015 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 09-16-2015 09:00 am.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court, in custody.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Court questions whether DE received a copy of the competency report.  DE states he didn't receive competency report or read it as it wasn't addressed to him.  Court addresses issue.  Report showed that DE is competent to proceed in the matter.  DE refuses to answer questions from the Court.  Court notes the continued gamesmanship and finds DE is competent to proceed.  Court urges DE to get counsel.  DE is provided w/public defender information as well as petition for indigency appeal to get court-appointed attorney.  Copy of document from his 2013 file also provided to DE by the Court.  DE again advised of right to counsel.  Court notes matter will be placed back on the FPT/JT calendar and there will be no more resets.  DE addresses issue re: jurisdiction.  State responds.  Parties argue re: the 13th amendment.  Court suggests any motion the DE might be making re: dismissal is denied.  Court notes documents provided in writing recently don't make any sense and are therefore denied.  Court sets JT for 9/16/2015.   Court advises DE there will be no resets due to lack of counsel after the FPT.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court, in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and Atty Albrecht states appearances.  Court questions DE on whether he wishes to proceed further w/o counsel or if he would like to apply for a public defender or file an indigency form in regard to this matter.  DE states he doesn't wish for anything at this time.  DE states an attorney is a foreign agent and would be against his interest at this time.  Court continues to question DE whether he wants counsel and DE refuses to answer his questions.  After several minutes the DE won't respond at all to questions.  Court provides DE a new waiver of right to attorney if he wishes to review it along with the information sheet from the public defenders office and indigency request form.  Court finds DE needs more time to consider his right to counsel and will reset the jury trial scheduled for 4/16/2015.  Matter will be reviewed out and we'll have another hearing/scheduling conference to see what the DE wants to do.  Court advises DE regarding further delays may result in the Court finding the DE has waived his right to counsel.  DE states he doesn't accept the Court's offer to contract and will not accept the forms provided to him today.  Court responds.  Atty Ryan states he has concerns re: competency.  Court notes he is required to order a competency evaulation since the issue has been raised.  Evaluator will go to the prison where DE is being held to complete the evulation.  Court orders competency evaluation.  Bond continued.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court, in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE states not the DE here today, wrongfully accused.  Court will take up notice of conflict of interest first, not signed.  Court not getting out of case, not dismissing.  DE states the jury panel was loaded and Court cannot be on this case being named as a DE in the federal court.   State ready to proceed.  5 yrs. probation on one count of felony bail jump concurrent to 13CF337 5 yr. prison term.  DE states doesn't understand.  Court leaves on trial calendar for next week.  DE demands release on these charges.  Court states motion on jurisdiction is denied.  DE states the 13th amendment has everything to do with this case.  Court denies motion.  DE states not an US citizen.  Court states DE has right of review by Court of Appeals.
& demand  of petition of the live man to claim his estate
of Conflict of Interest in 13CF337 Civil Rico Action Initiated
Final pre-trial on April 6, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Jury trial on April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on March 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court.   Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State moves/motions to join both cases for trial (13CF337 & 14CF103).  State states in 14CF103 is violating bond from 13CF337.  Same or similar character.  Judicial economy would be beneficial.  DE objects to joining cases at trial, should be tried separate, would confuse the jurors.  Court questions on the obstructing an officer.  State makes statement.  DE makes statement-false observation.  Court sites 971.12(4) - joining complaints for trial.  This involves samed defendant but different witnesses, locations, etc.  Court denies motion to join together for trial.  Back on the record.  Notices given to parties for FPT and JT for 13CF337, newer case will be set at later date.  Advises DE right to atty.  DE states still consulting atty.
compulsory judicial notice new evidence in the form of declaration by DE
Motion hearing on September 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states history/status of case re: counsel.  Court advises DE re: indigency paperwork.  Court advises DE of charges and maximum penalties in information.  DE pleads innocent.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial in Br 3.  Bond will continue.  20 days to file motions w/Br 3.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he does not qualify for public defender.  Request court appointed counsel.  Court continues to allow petition to be filled out.  Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE waives right to counsel for today's hearing.  Court questions DE on counsel waiver.  DE states he doesn't understands.  Court resets matter to allow DE time to seek counsel or go to public defender's office.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court.  Michael X Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes through rights to preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive preliminary.  Court goes through right to an attorney.  Defendant is undecided if he would like counsel.  Court allows State to proceed.  Matter has been reset twice for preliminary hearing.  State calls Officer Joshua Hoege, Reedsburg Police Department.  Sworn & testifies.  Officer identifies defendant.  Proceeds to describe incident in question.  Defendant objects, untruthful.  Court overruled.  State proceeds.  Defendant does not wish to testify or call witnesses.  State moves for bind over.  Defendant objects.    Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Defendant request argn.  State files information and handed to defendant.  Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo in court.  Micheal Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives status.  Reset from March 28, 2014.  Officer is not present today.  Notice issue from State.  State not prepared to proceed today.  Request reset for one week.  Defendant makes statement.  Moves court for dismissal.  Court denies motion to dismiss.  Reset preliminary hearing.  Defendant wishes to not be represented.  Court gives rights to an attorney.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Leonard J. Sundsmo appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Stan Woodard. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE doesn't qualify for PD representation.   ADA Mueller requests $1000.00 Cash bond.  Atty. Woodard requests $200 Cash bond and makes bail argument, not drinking.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  Court sets $500.00 CASH bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
